page.title: 10GRAND UNION CANAL,AN AMENITY
page.content: Although the Canal halped bring prosperity to Hemel, it is not much used now for carrying goods but it is used for boating holidays and moorings and people like to see the locks being used. One of the most popular hobbies is fishing. Many anglers spend the day relaxing on the banks. Although their lead weights can poison wildfowl and line and hooks harm wildlife, they need clean water for the fish. The canal is not badly polluted as freshwater shrimps and occasional trout show that oxygen is present. Algae on top suggest that some pollution occurs. Possibly as phosphates from detergents and nitrates from farmland. The towpath is a favourite place to walk safe from the traffic and its fumes and small cildren fish for sticklebacks with nets and jamjars.
